channel.title: sitespeed.io release feed
channel.description: Follow new releases of sitespeed.io tools
channel.copyright: All rights reserved 2021, Peter Hedenskog and team

item.title: browsertime 13.0.0
item.description: Updated the Docker container to use Chrome 92. Updated to Chromedriver 92. Upgrade to yargs 17 #1600. Fixed so that browsertime-result dir isn't created if you set your own result dir. Thank you Vicky Ledsom for PR #1611.

item.title: sitespeed.io 17.10.0
item.description: The Docker containers now contains Firefox 89 again. It seems like there's something with 90 that increase First Visual Change, especially when running in Docker. See https://phabricator.wikimedia.org/T286761 and https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1720843.

item.title: pagexray 4.3.1
item.description: Added missing inbodyparser_blocking render blocking info for Chrome.

item.title: coach-core 6.4.3
item.description: Updated to latest PageXray and Third patrty web 0.12.4.

item.title: throttle 2.1.1
item.description: A better check for missing net-tools on Linux, thank you Radu Micu for the PR #56.

item.title: coach 6.0.0
item.description: Use Browsertime 11.0.0 Use Coach-code 6.0 Use latest Firefox and Chrome

item.title: chrome-trace 0.2.2
item.description: Catch if we can't find the first thread event. We now throws an exception (that's not optimal since we don't know what's wrong) with the info of what's wrong. We can change that later on.

item.title: compare 1.0.0
item.description: Added support for using Github gists see #34. Added support for using a config file to configure which HARs to test. Added support for copy/paste directly you HAR, configuration file or a gist URL or id. Refactor the CSS into Sass, development build process now uses BrowserSync. Service worker added for offline support. Workbox is used to achieve this. Added support for showing changes in request/responses if you compare the same page #63.
